âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-Driven Analysis using OpenAI (GPT-4o) â€¢ Docker-Themed UI with nautical icons â€¢ Local-first analysis (checks local Docker daemon) â€¢ Security vulnerability detection (root user, secrets, packages) â€¢ Entertaining 'Container Dietician' persona for feedback
ðŸ“– Summary: Container Diet is an AI-powered CLI tool that analyzes Docker images and Dockerfiles to provide actionable optimization advice. It helps users reduce image size, improve security, and adhere to best practices with a fun,

ðŸš€ bj_led | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Integrating inexpensive Bluetooth LE LED strips (BJ_LED/MohuanLED) into Home Assistant for smart home automation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Home Assistant custom integration for BJ_LED devices â€¢ Control via Bluetooth LE â€¢ On/Off functionality â€¢ RGB color control â€¢ Basic brightness scaling
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a custom Home Assistant integration for controlling BJ_LED devices, which are inexpensive Bluetooth LE-enabled LED strips. It allows users to manage power, color, and basic modes of these lights directly from their Home Assistant dashboard.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ audioghost-ai | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extracting specific sounds (e.g., vocals, instruments, background noise) from audio or video files using natural language prompts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Text-Guided Separation â€¢ Video Upload Support â€¢ Memory Optimized (Lite mode) â€¢ Modern UI with waveform visualization â€¢ Real-time Progress Tracking
ðŸ“– Summary: AudioGhost AI is a desktop application that uses AI to separate or extract specific sounds from audio or video files based on natural language descriptions. It leverages a memory-optimized version of Meta's SAM-Audio model and provides a modern user interface with real-time progress and audio mixing capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ telegraph-parser | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extracting and processing article content from Telegra.ph URLs asynchronously.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Async parsing of Telegra.ph articles â€¢ Command-line interface for usage â€¢ Handles Telegra.ph URL formats including ordinal numbers for duplicate titles
ðŸ“– Summary: This Python repository provides an asynchronous parser for Telegra.ph articles. It allows users to fetch article content from Telegra.ph URLs, making it useful for applications that need to extract and process information from this platform.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ jumpserver | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a centralized, secure, and auditable platform for managing privileged access to IT infrastructure for DevOps and IT teams.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Secure access to SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, Database, and RemoteApp endpoints â€¢ Web-based access â€¢ On-demand access control â€¢ Privileged Access Management (PAM) â€¢ Open-source platform
ðŸ“– Summary: JumpServer is an open-source Privileged Access Management (PAM) platform that provides secure, on-demand access to various endpoints like SSH, RDP, Kubernetes, and databases through a web browser. It's designed for DevOps and IT teams to manage privileged access efficiently and securely.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ CamXploit | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Security research and reconnaissance to identify and analyze exposed IP cameras.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Scans common CCTV ports â€¢ Detects exposed camera login pages â€¢ Checks if the device is a camera stream â€¢ Identifies camera brands & known vulnerabilities â€¢ Tests for default credentials on login pages
ðŸ“– Summary: CamXploit is a Python-based reconnaissance tool designed to identify exposed IP cameras on the internet. It scans common ports, detects login pages, tests default credentials, and provides detailed information about camera brands and potential vulnerabilities.
